intro: Vaccinium corymbosum var. myrsinites, commonly known as the lowbush blueberry, is a variant of the blueberry plant native to eastern North America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring trailing stems and dense, evergreen foliage. The leaves are elliptical, leathery, and have a glossy dark green appearance with a slight waxy coating. It produces clusters of small, bell-shaped white flowers in the spring, which are followed by the characteristic blue-black berries. This variety is well adapted to acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and bogs.
